Articles.Content:
hi!

Tomorrow NASA will launch the Antares rocket.

As I think this might be interesting to some people on these forums,I made a thread to announce that.

Here's the link:

http://1.usa.gov/14YLGxb

the coverage start at 10:15 am EDT and the launch is scheduled to 10:50 EDT am.

Have fun!
There's also an Atlas 5 Launch tomorrow at 3:04AM EST from Cape Canaveral. Watch Here starting at 2:44AM EST

Thank you for the link!

By th way,are you sure it's 3:04 am EST and not 3:04 am EDT,there's exactly one hour between both.

NASA isn't doing the launch, OSC will be doing the launch. I so dearly want to watch the Antares launch but it happens at 10:16 CST a full 2 hours before school lunch so I can't watch it. I'll have to settle for the Atlas V launch then, any Idea what variant it is?
Sorry, it is EDT. Yes 3:04AM EDT is the start of the 2 hour launch window. Guessing we'll know of the actual countdown time when they start the stream at 2:45 EDT.
Yays! It's a night launch so I'll be able to see it!

What is that time in GMT? 6:45 AM? And will it be shown on NASA TV?

Sorry for the annoying questions!

No questions are annoying(or at least,no your questions).

In GMT,that make(for the launch at 10:50 am):14h50.

For the launch at 3:04,it make 7:03 am.

Source:http://wwp.greenwichmeantime.com/time-zone/usa/eastern-time/convert/

I don't if it will be shown on NASA tv,but for the launch at 13H50(GMT) will be shown here:http://1.usa.gov/14YLGxb

It may be shown there,but I don't know if it will be the case.
Given this thing is going to the ISS, there's essentially no possibility of it not being on nasa tv.
Looks interesting, i may watch it at school.

The link have changed.

The good link is:http://www.nasa.gov/multimedia/nasatv/index.html

I don't know why that last link is not good,they had announced that the launch will be shown on that link

Wife was invited to see the launch from the press box. I could not tag along sadly but I got to watch it form the beach. If only all my launches went that smooth.

Uploading a video now but all I had was my cell phone (Wife took the good camera since she was closer.) and it was attached to my binoculars. Was more focused on watching through them then making sure you could see the rocket in the video lol.
